bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 170 (Wednesday, September 30, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DUNN:H.R. 8443.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article , Section 8, Clause 1 states: ``The Congress shallhave Power to . . . provide for . . . the general Welfare ofthe United States . . .'' [Page H8458][Page H5105]

item.title: Caring Homes and Improved Lives for Dependents (CHILD) Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text:
Cottages Homes and Improved Lives for Dependents (CHILD) Act

This bill requires states to consider foster family homes or cottage homes to be the least restrictive setting for children who have attained six years of age and have been removed from their homes, if suitable relatives or other designated caregivers are not available. A cottage home is a residential operation

  • in which not more than 12 children reside;
  • that implements a trauma-informed care plan for its residents;
  • that involves family members of a child in the plan of service for the child, and maintains contact with the family of the child, if available and if the involvement supports the well-being of the child; and
  • that is licensed by the state where it is located.

The bill makes cottage homes eligible for foster care maintenance payments.

bill.title: Cottage Homes to Improve Lives for Dependents (CHILD) Act

item.title: Cottage Homes to Improve Lives for Dependents (CHILD) Act
Cottage Homes to Improve Lives for Dependents (CHILD) Act

To amend part E of title IV of the Social Security Act to require States to provide for the placement of a foster child in a cottage home, and to make a child so placed eligible for foster care maintenance payments.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
